Problems:

In a challenge like this, time shouldn't matter, and especially should not have a stopping point.

For any one mission there are essentially only two sane amounts of time, Hohmann Transfer Time and Hohman Overshoot Time (where your apoapsis is above the target, and thus it takes a bit more time.), starting from Low Kerbin Orbit. It can be decreased slightly if you launch directly into rendezvous orbit. Then there is another mission that would be insane past Mun or Minmus, and it is completely based upon how much delta-v and accelleration the ship has. Brachistrone transfers are essentially point-and-click orbits. You keep accelerating halfway, then turn the other was any slow down. The transfer time is based upon how quickly your rocket accelerates and if it has to shutdown its engine partway to conserve Delta-V.

It would be really cool to see someone do an Eve flyby or orbit without using the map view. They'd probably need DistantObjectEnhancement so they could see it from a distance. Several people have gone to Mun and Minmus without map view, take Abyssal Lurker's example for his Old School series. (By now, THAT series is really old school, but you get the picture. No map view. Each are done in 0.14 and 0.15 respectively, but are simulating 0.8.)
